TopicTitle: What's up with whackjob? Please Explain.

Articles.Content:
I just joined in the forums (A few days ago) And i've been hearing about this user whackjob. Like...Here's some quotes.

Sure, and you could try ironing your shirts with a steam roller.
In reply to that other quote he sayed: Whackjob does.

Please explain whats up with whackjob please Lol.

This, is Whackjob.

Eh...I can see now. HOW MUCH STRUTS DID THAT PERSON...use wow...that's just...wow, amazing and weird at the same time, A little more explanation would help too lol. I still kinda don't get it

In other words, Whackjob is the god of Over-engineering.

Most of his crafts are 1,000+ parts... in orbit.

He pushes ksp to the limits.
Oh thanks dude! You explained it ALL...

Whackjob:

When it absolutely, positively must be delivered to space (and you've got a week to wait on lag).

Eh...I can see now. HOW MUCH STRUTS DID THAT PERSON...use wow...that's just...wow, amazing and weird at the same time, A little more explanation would help too lol. I still kinda don't get it

you got the amazing and weird, throw in a healthy dose of absurd, and a large helping of why?....because i CAN, and you'll have it pretty much explained.

Whatever you think of as well beyond the normal limit is below the operating standards of a Whackjob creation, it just is.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/36572-I-am-full-of-grief-and-coffee?p=842855&viewfull=1#post842855

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/36572-I-am-full-of-grief-and-coffee?p=862734&viewfull=1#post862734

and one of the earliest descriptions of what Whackjob does:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/36572-I-am-full-of-grief-and-coffee?p=464743&viewfull=1#post464743

soon followed by his own admission

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/36572-I-am-full-of-grief-and-coffee?p=466887&viewfull=1#post466887

Not sure what else to say other than, since you'll see it eventually, Whackjob, what's after the thrillsphere? Thrillsphere on the mun?

Edited December 30, 2013 by Amram

Some of my creations are whack job worthy...

That VTOL weighs 115 TONS.
I went through a big phase too...

I too had my time with building huge rockets with payloads at 100t+ (although that's not an insane amount). It's not really difficult but ya gotta know the secret (struts everywhere).

Right now, I'm in a fase where I'm building realistic rockets, but am growing into the big rocket thing again as I'm lovi'n the rescaled solar system mod! Just to get into orbit you need about 8km/s+ DV, and I've gotten a satellite in low Lunar orbit!!

From a stable orbit at about 200km altitude, it requires around 3-3,5km/s DV to get a trans-lunar trajectory!

With the Rescaled solar system mod my record payload into Earth orbit is app. 3t.
I'm trying to get a 300 ton mega-rover to the Mun. And I'm pretty dang close Wackjob worthy?

D'aw. I remember when he was but a newbie, all dosed up on coffee and regret, with several splat-marks around KSC but not much else to his name.

And now look at him. All grown up and a forum legend and everything.

Brings a tear to your eye.

D'aw. I remember when he was but a newbie, all dosed up on coffee and regret, with several splat-marks around KSC but not much else to his name.

And now look at him. All grown up and a forum legend and everything.

Brings a tear to your eye.

*sniff* they grow up so fast...

More like

"They blow up so fast...."

EDIT: I meant kerbals...

Edited January 2, 2014 by Krosulhah
Wasn't he the guy that sent the mega-mission to Duna?

Some of my creations are whack job worthy...

That VTOL weighs 115 TONS.

http://i.imgur.com/YYMapPN.jpg

Scale it up by five, and then maybe I'd be comparing it to Whackjob

Although, his planes are (for now) smaller than his rockets, so maybe.
His name is quite self explanatory.
